body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:

`kube-proxy`, from whatever combination of inputs we stuck into it, segfaulted. The segfault, which originates from a slightly modified fork of v1.17, looks as such:

```
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x20 pc=0x3d1c786]
goroutine 149 [running]:
k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/proxy/healthcheck.(*ProxierHealthServer).Updated(0x0)
        /go/src/kubernetes/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/proxy/healthcheck/proxier_health.go:83 +0x26
k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/proxy/iptables.(*Proxier).SyncLoop(0xc00014db00)
        /go/src/kubernetes/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/proxy/iptables/proxier.go:474 +0x62
k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-proxy/app.(*ProxyServer).Run(0xc0001fc480, 0xc0004acc60, 0xc0004acc60)
        /go/src/kubernetes/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-proxy/app/server.go:714 +0x735
k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-proxy/app.(*Options).runLoop.func1(0xc0002b1a80)
        /go/src/kubernetes/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-proxy/app/server.go:324 +0x34
created by k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-proxy/app.(*Options).runLoop
        /go/src/kubernetes/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/cmd/kube-proxy/app/server.go:323 +0x50
```

Translated to master, where the problem appears to be present, the segfault originates from this call:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/d90dd93855ab6c3ccda73dfbd3d19c81f56abca5/pkg/proxy/healthcheck/proxier_health.go#L89

And that is called from here:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/d90dd93855ab6c3ccda73dfbd3d19c81f56abca5/pkg/proxy/iptables/proxier.go#L512-L514

This seems odd, because

* The only pointer involved in the segfaulting call is `hs` itself
* The caller nil-checks before calling a method on `hs`.

I did some digging and found #49137, which is a fix for this problem. However, this fix appears to be undone in #83498. There doesn't seem to be a reason for this to have been changed in the latter PR.

**What you expected to happen**:

`kube-proxy` should not segfault from any bizarre combination of user input. If the situation is invalid, it should fail gracefully.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

Honestly, I'm not 100% sure what combination of inputs we crammed into `kube-proxy`, but I can locate them and post them if necessary.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

I don't feel confident opening a PR to fix this myself, but in addition to recreating the fix from #49137, a comment should be added explaining why there is this weird, seemingly pointless layer of indirection when assigning to the interface, so that this doesn't get un-fixed again.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

title: kube-proxy can panic if len(HealthzBindAddresses) == 0
